information: The political climate in Côte d'Ivoire is marked by the disqualification of several opposition figures ahead of the October 2025 election. In April 2025, Tidjane Thiam, leader of the main opposition party PDCI-RDA, was disqualified after a court ruled he did not meet eligibility conditions due to his prior dual French-Ivorian nationality, despite having renounced his French citizenship. This and other exclusions have led to protests and accusations of electoral manipulation. Reports also mention that other political figures like Charles Blé Goudé and Guillaume Soro have been excluded from the electoral process due to judicial convictions. In response to the political tensions, various groups, including religious leaders and the UN, have called for peaceful dialogue.

forecast.status_quo_outcome: No - none of the five specified candidates have been disqualified yet
forecast.no_outcome_scenario: All five candidates (Gnangbo Kacou, Laurent Gbagbo, Pascal Affi N'Guessan, Jean-Louis Billon, and Simone Gbagbo) remain on the electoral list and legally eligible through July 1, 2025. The recent wave of disqualifications (Tidjane Thiam in April, plus Blé Goudé and Soro) represents the completion of the government's efforts to exclude opposition figures, with no further action taken against these five specific candidates in the remaining month.
forecast.yes_outcome_scenario: At least one of the five candidates faces disqualification before July 1, 2025. Most likely would be Laurent Gbagbo or Simone Gbagbo given their controversial political histories and potential legal vulnerabilities, or another candidate targeted through judicial proceedings similar to those used against Tidjane Thiam (nationality eligibility) or other opposition figures (criminal convictions).
forecast.rationale: The research assistant's report reveals an active pattern of opposition disqualifications in the lead-up to the October 2025 election. Tidjane Thiam was disqualified in April 2025 on technical grounds (dual nationality), and others like Blé Goudé and Soro have been excluded via judicial convictions. This demonstrates both the government's willingness to use legal mechanisms to exclude opposition candidates and the charged political environment. With 32 days remaining until July 1, there is sufficient time for additional disqualification proceedings. However, several factors moderate my forecast: (1) None of the five specified candidates have been disqualified yet, and status quo bias suggests they may remain eligible; (2) I lack specific information about pending legal challenges against any of these five individuals; (3) The most prominent recent disqualification (Thiam) targeted someone not on this list, suggesting current enforcement may focus elsewhere; (4) Some disqualifications may have already occurred in the April wave. Laurent and Simone Gbagbo stand out as higher-risk candidates given their political histories, but without concrete evidence of proceedings against them, I cannot assign high probability. My forecast would increase if credible sources report legal challenges or eligibility reviews targeting any of these five candidates. It would decrease if these candidates are confirmed on final electoral lists or if the July 1 deadline approaches without new disqualification activity.

prompt:
You are a professional forecaster interviewing for a job.

Your interview question is:
Will any of these candidates be disqualified from running in the 2025 Ivorian presidential election before July 1, 2025?

Question background:
BBC: [Main opposition leader removed from Ivory Coast electoral list](https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/c0l0j849143o)


This question's outcome will be determined by the specific criteria below. These criteria have not yet been satisfied:
This question resolves as **Yes** if before July 1, 2025, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/faq/#definitions) any of these candidates has been removed from the electoral list or otherwise become legally ineligible to run in the [2025 presidential election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2025_Ivorian_presidential_election) of the Ivory Coast (Côte d'Ivoire) under the laws of the country: Gnangbo Kacou, Laurent Gbagbo, Pascal Affi N'Guessan, Jean-Louis Billon, or Simone Gbagbo.




Your research assistant's report says:
The political climate in Côte d'Ivoire is marked by the disqualification of several opposition figures ahead of the October 2025 election. In April 2025, Tidjane Thiam, leader of the main opposition party PDCI-RDA, was disqualified after a court ruled he did not meet eligibility conditions due to his prior dual French-Ivorian nationality, despite having renounced his French citizenship. This and other exclusions have led to protests and accusations of electoral manipulation. Reports also mention that other political figures like Charles Blé Goudé and Guillaume Soro have been excluded from the electoral process due to judicial convictions. In response to the political tensions, various groups, including religious leaders and the UN, have called for peaceful dialogue.

Today is 2025-05-30.

Before answering you think:
(a) The time left until the outcome to the question is known.
(b) The status quo outcome if nothing changed.
(c) A brief description of a scenario that results in a No outcome.
(d) A brief description of a scenario that results in a Yes outcome.
(e) You write your rationale remembering that good forecasters put extra weight on the status quo outcome since the world changes slowly most of the time. Explain your reasoning and the evidence behind your forecast in detail. Summarise information your received from your research assistant that influences your forecast (if any). Explain why your forecast is not higher, and why it is not lower. Outline what would need to be true for you to update your forecast in either direction.
(f) The last thing you write is your final probabilistic forecast as a number between 0 and 100.

# OUTPUT SCHEMA
{
    "time_left_until_outcome_known": "string",
    "status_quo_outcome": "string",
    "no_outcome_scenario": "string",
    "yes_outcome_scenario": "string",
    "rationale": "string",
    "probability": "number" (0-100)
}
